page.title: 12DAIRY FARMING WOOLPIT
page.content: We visited Mr. Coddington's dairy farm. Altogether there are 270 cattle. There are 99 milking Jerseys. 14 cows are milked at a time. On the day we visited, one cow gave 14 kg. in the morning and 9 kg. in the afternoon. The milk tanker collects the milk at 8.00 a.m. The tanker holds 1,916 kg. 84 cows sleep in cubicles on rubber mats. The rest sleep in straw yards. One cow has a ring in her nose because she sucks milk from other cows. The bull is three years old and his name is Sam. The cows calve in September. They have an eight-week rest before calving. Then they are milked for the next 305 days. Mr. Isaac's farm, near Tostock. My Dad is stockman. The farm has a Charolais herd. The champion bull is called Royal. My Dad takes him for walks every day.
